output.name: Output
output.value1: Transformer stage gives the user an ability to modify columns that will be written to some data storage later on.
output.value2: The customization allows for (and not limited to):
output.value5: 3. Use spark-sql functions/procedures to modify (or create new) columns.

value6.title: For more information about Built-in Functions click here.

output.value12: 3) a, b, row_number() OVER (PARTITION BY a ORDER BY b)

note.name: Note
note.firstText: if the whole object's name is not guarded by
note.value1: An identifier is a string used to identify a database object such as a table, view, schema, column, etc. Spark SQL has regular
note.value2: identifiers and delimited identifiers, which are enclosed within backticks. Therefore be vigilant when you reference certain
note.value3: database objects in your query since some might have symbols that might be misinterpreted (e.g. spark function invocation)

value4.title: For more information of backticks click here.
